meanings.definition: To consume the flesh of one's own species.
meanings.sent1: The tribe was cannibalising their fallen enemies for survival.
meanings.sent2: The lion was cannibalising the weaker members of its pride.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie featured a tribe cannibalising unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the monster was cannibalising its own kind for strength.
meanings.sent5: The zombie apocalypse showed creatures cannibalising each other for food.

meanings.definition: To use parts of a machine or system to repair or build another machine or system.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic was cannibalising old cars to fix the vintage model.
meanings.sent2: The engineer was cannibalising the broken computer to create a new one.
meanings.sent3: The robot was cannibalising spare parts to upgrade itself.
meanings.sent4: The inventor was cannibalising old inventions to make a new gadget.
meanings.sent5: The DIY enthusiast was cannibalising old electronics for a new project.

meanings.definition: To take customers or market share away from a similar product or service within the same company.
meanings.sent1: The new product was cannibalising sales from the existing one.
meanings.sent2: The discount offer was cannibalising the premium service.
meanings.sent3: The promotion was cannibalising the regular sales.
meanings.sent4: The new feature was cannibalising the older version.
meanings.sent5: The updated model was cannibalising the previous one in the market.
